title: WP-CLI Configuration Schema
description: JSON Schema for validating wp-cli.yml configuration files

ssh.description: Perform operation against a remote server over SSH.

http.description: Perform operation against a remote WordPress installation over HTTP.

url.description: Pretend request came from given URL. In multisite, this argument is how the target site is specified.

skip-plugins.description: Skip loading all or some plugins. Note: mu-plugins are still loaded.

skip-themes.description: Skip loading all or some themes.

require.description: Load PHP file before running the command (may be used more than once).

exec.description: Execute PHP code before running the command (may be used more than once).

context.description: Load WordPress in a given context.

debug.description: Show all PHP errors; add verbosity to WP-CLI bootstrap.

apache_modules.description: List of Apache Modules that are to be reported as loaded.

merge.description: Merge subcommand defaults from the upstream config.yml, instead of overriding

inherit.description: Inherit configuration from an arbitrary YAML file

_.description: '_' is a special value denoting configuration options for this wp-cli.yml

url.description: Pretend request came from given URL. In multisite, this argument is how the target site is specified.

ssh.description: Perform operation against a remote server over SSH (or a container using scheme of "docker", "docker-compose", "docker-compose-run", "vagrant").

http.description: Perform operation against a remote WordPress installation over HTTP.

oneOf.description: Aliases can reference other aliases to create alias groups. Alias groups can be nested

^@[_a-zA-Z][_a-zA-Z0-9]*$.description: Aliases to other WordPress installs (e.g. `wp @staging rewrite flush`)
